skill.name: biorxiv-database
skill.description: Efficient database search tool for bioRxiv preprint server. Use this skill when searching for life sciences preprints by keywords, authors, date ranges, or categories, retrieving paper metadata, downloading PDFs, or conducting literature reviews.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate Python tool that queries the bioRxiv API and downloads PDFs. It writes results to user-specified paths but has no access to environment variables, no external command execution, and makes only documented API calls to api.biorxiv.org. Behavior matches the stated research purpose.

content.value_statement: Finding relevant preprints across long date ranges is slow. This skill searches bioRxiv with filters and returns structured metadata and optional PDF downloads.
actual_capabilities: Search preprints by date range with optional category filter
Search by author name within a date window
Search by keywords across title, abstract, or authors
Download a PDF for a DOI to a chosen path
Output results as formatted JSON to file or stdout
limitations: Keyword search requires a start date or days back parameter
PDF downloads always use version v1 of the paper
Large date ranges can be slow due to API response size
Requires network access to bioRxiv endpoints

use_cases.title: Start a literature scan
use_cases.description: Collect recent preprints in a topic and review titles, authors, and abstracts.

use_cases.title: Track author outputs
use_cases.description: Monitor new preprints from specific researchers over defined dates.

use_cases.title: Build metadata datasets
use_cases.description: Export structured records for analysis, dashboards, or citation tools.

prompt_templates.title: Find recent papers
prompt_templates.prompt: Search bioRxiv for CRISPR in the last 30 days and save results to results.json

prompt_templates.title: Author scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Find bioRxiv papers by author Johnson from 2023-01-01 to 2024-12-31 and report the count

prompt_templates.title: Category focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for deep learning in neuroscience from 2024-01-01 to 2024-06-30 and list the top 10 titles

prompt_templates.title: Download PDFs
prompt_templates.prompt: Get details for DOI 10.1101/2024.01.15.123456 and download the PDF to papers/123456.pdf

output_examples.input: Find genomics preprints from June 2024 and summarize the top results.
output: Top titles include advances in genome editing and long read assembly
Saved metadata with DOI, authors, and links for each paper

best_practices: Use narrow date ranges for faster responses
Add category filters to improve relevance
Save JSON outputs to avoid repeated API calls
anti_patterns: Running large date ranges without a limit
Using keyword search without a start date
Assuming PDF versions without checking metadata

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It is a Python script and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code environments.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: The API can rate limit requests, and large date ranges can return many results.

faq.question: Can I integrate results with other tools?
faq.answer: Yes. Export JSON and load it into analysis tools or convert it to CSV.

faq.question: Does it access my private data?
faq.answer: No. It only calls bioRxiv endpoints and writes files you specify.

faq.question: What should I do if I get no results?
faq.answer: Check date ranges, category names, and keyword spelling, then try broader filters.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual search?
faq.answer: It automates queries, returns structured metadata, and supports batch workflows.
